speed_print.label: Print Speed
speed_print.description: The speed at which printing happens.

speed_infill.label: Infill Speed
speed_infill.description: The speed at which infill is printed.

speed_wall.label: Wall Speed
speed_wall.description: The speed at which the walls are printed.

speed_wall_0.label: Outer Wall Speed
speed_wall_0.description: The speed at which the outermost walls are printed. Printing the outer wall at a lower speed improves the final skin quality. However, having a large difference between the inner wall speed and the outer wall speed will affect quality in a negative way.

speed_wall_x.label: Inner Wall Speed
speed_wall_x.description: The speed at which all inner walls are printed. Printing the inner wall faster than the outer wall will reduce printing time. It works well to set this in between the outer wall speed and the infill speed.

speed_roofing.label: Top Surface Skin Speed
speed_roofing.description: The speed at which top surface skin layers are printed.

speed_topbottom.label: Top/Bottom Speed
speed_topbottom.description: The speed at which top/bottom layers are printed.

speed_support.label: Support Speed
speed_support.description: The speed at which the support structure is printed. Printing support at higher speeds can greatly reduce printing time. The surface quality of the support structure is not important since it is removed after printing.

speed_support_infill.label: Support Infill Speed
speed_support_infill.description: The speed at which the infill of support is printed. Printing the infill at lower speeds improves stability.

speed_support_interface.label: Support Interface Speed
speed_support_interface.description: The speed at which the roofs and floors of support are printed. Printing them at lower speeds can improve overhang quality.

speed_support_roof.label: Support Roof Speed
speed_support_roof.description: The speed at which the roofs of support are printed. Printing them at lower speeds can improve overhang quality.

speed_support_bottom.label: Support Floor Speed
speed_support_bottom.description: The speed at which the floor of support is printed. Printing it at lower speed can improve adhesion of support on top of your model.

speed_prime_tower.label: Prime Tower Speed
speed_prime_tower.description: The speed at which the prime tower is printed. Printing the prime tower slower can make it more stable when the adhesion between the different filaments is suboptimal.

speed_travel.label: Travel Speed
speed_travel.description: The speed at which travel moves are made.

speed_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Speed
speed_layer_0.description: The speed for the initial layer. A lower value is advised to improve adhesion to the build plate. Does not affect the build plate adhesion structures themselves, like brim and raft.

speed_print_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Print Speed
speed_print_layer_0.description: The speed of printing for the initial layer. A lower value is advised to improve adhesion to the build plate.

speed_travel_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Travel Speed
speed_travel_layer_0.description: The speed of travel moves in the initial layer. A lower value is advised to prevent pulling previously printed parts away from the build plate. The value of this setting can automatically be calculated from the ratio between the Travel Speed and the Print Speed.

skirt_brim_speed.label: Skirt/Brim Speed
skirt_brim_speed.description: The speed at which the skirt and brim are printed. Normally this is done at the initial layer speed, but sometimes you might want to print the skirt or brim at a different speed.
skirt_brim_speed.enabled: resolveOrValue('adhesion_type') == 'skirt' or resolveOrValue('adhesion_type') == 'brim' or resolveOrValue('draft_shield_enabled') or resolveOrValue('ooze_shield_enabled')

speed_z_hop.label: Z Hop Speed
speed_z_hop.description: The speed at which the vertical Z movement is made for Z Hops. This is typically lower than the print speed since the build plate or machine's gantry is harder to move.

speed_slowdown_layers.label: Number of Slower Layers
speed_slowdown_layers.description: The first few layers are printed slower than the rest of the model, to get better adhesion to the build plate and improve the overall success rate of prints. The speed is gradually increased over these layers.

speed_equalize_flow_width_factor.label: Flow Equalization Ratio
speed_equalize_flow_width_factor.description: Extrusion width based correction factor on the speed. At 0% the movement speed is kept constant at the Print Speed. At 100% the movement speed is adjusted so that the flow (in mm³/s) is kept constant, i.e. lines half the normal Line Width are printed twice as fast and lines twice as wide are printed half as fast. A value larger than 100% can help to compensate for the higher pressure required to extrude wide lines.

acceleration_enabled.label: Enable Acceleration Control
acceleration_enabled.description: Enables adjusting the print head acceleration. Increasing the accelerations can reduce printing time at the cost of print quality.

acceleration_travel_enabled.label: Enable Travel Acceleration
acceleration_travel_enabled.description: Use a separate acceleration rate for travel moves. If disabled, travel moves will use the acceleration value of the printed line at their destination.

acceleration_print.label: Print Acceleration
acceleration_print.description: The acceleration with which printing happens.

acceleration_infill.label: Infill Acceleration
acceleration_infill.description: The acceleration with which infill is printed.

acceleration_wall.label: Wall Acceleration
acceleration_wall.description: The acceleration with which the walls are printed.

acceleration_wall_0.label: Outer Wall Acceleration
acceleration_wall_0.description: The acceleration with which the outermost walls are printed.

acceleration_wall_x.label: Inner Wall Acceleration
acceleration_wall_x.description: The acceleration with which all inner walls are printed.

acceleration_roofing.label: Top Surface Skin Acceleration
acceleration_roofing.description: The acceleration with which top surface skin layers are printed.

acceleration_topbottom.label: Top/Bottom Acceleration
acceleration_topbottom.description: The acceleration with which top/bottom layers are printed.

acceleration_support.label: Support Acceleration
acceleration_support.description: The acceleration with which the support structure is printed.

acceleration_support_infill.label: Support Infill Acceleration
acceleration_support_infill.description: The acceleration with which the infill of support is printed.

acceleration_support_interface.label: Support Interface Acceleration
acceleration_support_interface.description: The acceleration with which the roofs and floors of support are printed. Printing them at lower acceleration can improve overhang quality.
acceleration_support_interface.enabled: resolveOrValue('acceleration_enabled') and support_interface_enable and (support_enable or support_meshes_present)

acceleration_support_roof.label: Support Roof Acceleration
acceleration_support_roof.description: The acceleration with which the roofs of support are printed. Printing them at lower acceleration can improve overhang quality.
acceleration_support_roof.enabled: acceleration_enabled and support_roof_enable and (support_enable or support_meshes_present)

acceleration_support_bottom.label: Support Floor Acceleration
acceleration_support_bottom.description: The acceleration with which the floors of support are printed. Printing them at lower acceleration can improve adhesion of support on top of your model.
acceleration_support_bottom.enabled: acceleration_enabled and support_bottom_enable and (support_enable or support_meshes_present)

acceleration_prime_tower.label: Prime Tower Acceleration
acceleration_prime_tower.description: The acceleration with which the prime tower is printed.

acceleration_travel.label: Travel Acceleration
acceleration_travel.description: The acceleration with which travel moves are made.

acceleration_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Acceleration
acceleration_layer_0.description: The acceleration for the initial layer.

acceleration_print_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Print Acceleration
acceleration_print_layer_0.description: The acceleration during the printing of the initial layer.

acceleration_travel_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Travel Acceleration
acceleration_travel_layer_0.description: The acceleration for travel moves in the initial layer.

acceleration_skirt_brim.label: Skirt/Brim Acceleration
acceleration_skirt_brim.description: The acceleration with which the skirt and brim are printed. Normally this is done with the initial layer acceleration, but sometimes you might want to print the skirt or brim at a different acceleration.
acceleration_skirt_brim.enabled: resolveOrValue('acceleration_enabled') and (resolveOrValue('adhesion_type') == 'skirt' or resolveOrValue('adhesion_type') == 'brim' or resolveOrValue('draft_shield_enabled') or resolveOrValue('ooze_shield_enabled'))

jerk_enabled.label: Enable Jerk Control
jerk_enabled.description: Enables adjusting the jerk of print head when the velocity in the X or Y axis changes. Increasing the jerk can reduce printing time at the cost of print quality.

jerk_travel_enabled.label: Enable Travel Jerk
jerk_travel_enabled.description: Use a separate jerk rate for travel moves. If disabled, travel moves will use the jerk value of the printed line at their destination.

jerk_print.label: Print Jerk
jerk_print.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change of the print head.

jerk_infill.label: Infill Jerk
jerk_infill.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which infill is printed.

jerk_wall.label: Wall Jerk
jerk_wall.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the walls are printed.

jerk_wall_0.label: Outer Wall Jerk
jerk_wall_0.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the outermost walls are printed.

jerk_wall_x.label: Inner Wall Jerk
jerk_wall_x.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which all inner walls are printed.

jerk_roofing.label: Top Surface Skin Jerk
jerk_roofing.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which top surface skin layers are printed.

jerk_topbottom.label: Top/Bottom Jerk
jerk_topbottom.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which top/bottom layers are printed.

jerk_support.label: Support Jerk
jerk_support.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the support structure is printed.

jerk_support_infill.label: Support Infill Jerk
jerk_support_infill.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the infill of support is printed.

jerk_support_interface.label: Support Interface Jerk
jerk_support_interface.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the roofs and floors of support are printed.
jerk_support_interface.enabled: resolveOrValue('jerk_enabled') and support_interface_enable and (support_enable or support_meshes_present)

jerk_support_roof.label: Support Roof Jerk
jerk_support_roof.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the roofs of support are printed.
jerk_support_roof.enabled: resolveOrValue('jerk_enabled') and support_roof_enable and (support_enable or support_meshes_present)

jerk_support_bottom.label: Support Floor Jerk
jerk_support_bottom.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the floors of support are printed.
jerk_support_bottom.enabled: resolveOrValue('jerk_enabled') and support_bottom_enable and (support_enable or support_meshes_present)

jerk_prime_tower.label: Prime Tower Jerk
jerk_prime_tower.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the prime tower is printed.

jerk_travel.label: Travel Jerk
jerk_travel.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which travel moves are made.

jerk_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Jerk
jerk_layer_0.description: The print maximum instantaneous velocity change for the initial layer.

jerk_print_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Print Jerk
jerk_print_layer_0.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change during the printing of the initial layer.

jerk_travel_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Travel Jerk
jerk_travel_layer_0.description: The acceleration for travel moves in the initial layer.

jerk_skirt_brim.label: Skirt/Brim Jerk
jerk_skirt_brim.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the skirt and brim are printed.
jerk_skirt_brim.enabled: resolveOrValue('jerk_enabled') and (resolveOrValue('adhesion_type') == 'skirt' or resolveOrValue('adhesion_type') == 'brim' or resolveOrValue('draft_shield_enabled') or resolveOrValue('ooze_shield_enabled'))

machine_start_gcode.default_value:
G21
G90
M82
M107 T0
M140 S{material_bed_temperature}
M104 S{material_print_temperature} T0
M190 S{material_bed_temperature}
M109 S{material_print_temperature} T0
G28
G1 F3000 Z1
G1 X-150 Y0 Z0.4
G92 E0
G3 X0 Y-130 I150 Z0.3 E30 F2000
G92 E0

machine_end_gcode.default_value:
M107 T0
M104 S0
M104 S0 T1
M140 S0
G92 E0
G91
G1 E-1 F300
G1 Z+0.5  F6000
G28 
G90 ;absolute positioning
